00022 #ifdef _WIN32

00024 #endif
00025 #include <FdoStd.h>
00026 #include <fdo/Commands/PropertyValueCollection.h>
00027 
00028 /// \brief
00029 /// FdoINetworkPathReader is an interface that is used to return the result of a single path 
00030 /// from the result returned by the network analysis command. The path is usually made of node features 
00031 /// and link features. Some of the analysis commands returns only node features.
00032 /// \note
00033 /// This Help topic is provided for informational use only. There is
00034 /// no interface or support provided. Autodesk reserves the right to change
00035 /// the software related to the content herein.
00036 class FdoINetworkPathReader : public GisIDisposable
00037 {
00038 
00039 public:
00040     /// \brief
00041     /// This method is used to advance to the next link or node of the path.
00042     /// 
00043     /// \return
00044     /// Returns true if a node or link exist. false otherwise
00045     /// 
00046     FDO_API virtual bool ReadNext() = 0;
00047 
00048     /// \brief
00049     /// This method is used to determine if the current network feature is a node feature.
00050     /// 
00051     /// \return
00052     /// Returns true if the current feature is a node. false otherwise
00053     /// 
00054     FDO_API virtual bool IsNode() = 0;
00055 
00056     /// \brief
00057     /// This method is used to return the identifier value of the current network feature.
00058     /// 
00059     /// \return
00060     /// Returns a name value pair collection that identify the link or node.
00061     /// 
00062     FDO_API virtual FdoPropertyValueCollection* GetId() = 0;
00063 
00064     /// \brief
00065     /// This method is used to return the end node of path. This is useful if the application 
00066     /// is only interested in the end point of the network analysis.
00067     /// 
00068     /// \return
00069     /// Returns a name value pair collection that identify the end node.
00070     /// 
00071     FDO_API virtual FdoPropertyValueCollection* GetEndNode() = 0;
00072 };
00073 #endif
00074
